column4: Is migrating linux to a different harddrive as simple as copy/paste the contents of your partition, and adding a new boot manager to your MBR?
or is there invisible stuff ingrained in the partition, like the windows registry?
if you have linux installed on /dev/hda1
it will mount /dev/hda1 on / for instance
you have to tell hime not to do so, if you change partition
I mean can I just do a "cp -a / /mount-point-for-partition-on-new-drive"?
I'm thinking it might not be, with the work I've put into this install... plus the downloads i put into it :) (all those .deb's)
